properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 10:48AM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...

.A significant winter storm is expected to impact the region late
Wednesday afternoon through Thursday, with widespread heavy
mountain snow accumulations likely. Snow levels are expected to
fall from 3500 to nearly 2000 feet early Thursday morning, which
will bring heavy snow accumulations to numerous interior mountain
highways, including Highways 299, 36, and 3, in addition to
numerous rural roadways. In addition, accumulating small hail will
be possible across coastal areas late Wednesday night into
Thursday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2000 feet. 1 to 2 feet of snow
expected at elevations over 2500 feet. Snow accumulations of 2
to 4 inches possible down to 2000 feet. Gusty south winds at
the onset of the snow will diminish quickly overnight.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County.

* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Thursday. The heaviest
snow is expected late tonight into Thursday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET
